featured.text: But as the magic fades and daily life __(33)__, it happens that men, forgetting that men and women are supposed to be different, continue to expect women to think and react the way men do; women, __(34)__, expect men to feel and behave the way women do.
Dad certainly had the list 33 when he left for the market, but he would somehow forget it, and then would find it again only after he returned home.
We forgot to take a can-opener along!
As she sang, Whitfield’s voice was so powerful and soulful that everyone in the room forgot the wheelchair was even there.
“I’ll never forget this speech,” said one graduate.

other.text: But there is one thing he would never forget: showing up for dinner on time.
“You forget a political leader, but you won’t forget a robot.” 41.

definition.zh_def: 忘記，無法記住或回憶起某事。
definition.example: I always forget where I put my keys.
